isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - ELECTRONIC ENGINES, CUMMINS M11E AND N14E - OPERATION - Speedometer/Tachometer Inputs

svcprocinfo.para: The ECM provides a signal over the data link that the vehicle speedometer/tachometer cluster microprocessor uses to drive the gauges. The ECM receives input from Engine Position sensor (Cummins component) to determine engine speed and receives a signal from the vehicle speed sensor to determine vehicle speed. The signal to the speedometer/tachometer microprocessor is sent from the ECM through the ATA data link circuits 98(+) and 98B(-) to data link connectors J6 (Blue) and J5 (Red). Circuit 47/48(+) from J5 and 47/48(-) from J6 connect to the speedometer/tachometer unit at connector (27).

svcsubproc.title: POSITIVE DATA LINK CIRCUIT TO SPEEDOMETER AND TACHOMETER
svcsubproc.para: Positive data link circuit 98(+) connects ECM connector (320) terminal 27 to Data link Positive Connector (355). Data Link Positive Connector (355) is connected by circuit 47/48(+) to speedometer/tachometer connector (27). Data Link Positive Connector (355) is connected by circuit 98(+) to the ATA Data Link Connector (313). ATA Data Link Connector (313) can be used to access information on the data link using an electronic service tool.

svcsubproc.title: NEGATIVE DATA LINK CIRCUIT TO SPEEDOMETER AND TACHOMETER
svcsubproc.para: Negative data link circuit 98B(-) connects ECM connector (320) terminal 8 to Data Link Negative Connector (356). Data Link Negative Connector (356) is connected by circuit 47/48(-) to speedometer/tachometer connector (27). Data Link Negative Connector (356) is connected by circuit 98C(-) to the ATA Data Link connector (313). ATA Data Link connector (313) can be used to access information on the data link using an electronic service tool.

svcsubproc.title: ECM Programming
svcsubproc.para: The ECM is programmed with vehicle component information, so the signal to the speedometer and tachometer is compatible. That information includes the following:

item.para: Magnetic Pickup VSS - YES or NO.
Number of Transmission Tail Shaft Gear Teeth - International installed transmissions have 16 teeth on counter wheel, including Allison transmissions.
Tire revolutions per mile. Refer to CT-400, Sales Data Book, Component Book.
Top gear final drive ratio (0.5 to 1.0).

svcsubproc.para: If vehicle components are changed (different tire size, rear axle etc.) the ECM must be reprogrammed with the correct data. An authorized Cummins EST is required for the reprogramming. Refer to Cummins service literature for this procedure.

svcsubproc.title: VEHICLE SPEED SENSOR (VSS) (325)
svcsubproc.para: The VSS (325) is located at the rear of the transmission. The sensor contains a permanent magnet which creates a field that is repeatedly broken by the rotating speedometer output gear in the transmission. The gear has 16 teeth.

As the gear breaks the field an alternating current (AC) is generated. These pulses are transmitted from sensor connector (325) through circuits 97AJ and 97AK to the ECM through ECM connector (320) at terminals 3 and 7.
